thread.title: Team Tips: Halves shake-up, Titanic risk
thread.title_full: Team Tips: Halves shake-up, Titanic risk

title: Team Tips: Halves shake-up, Titanic risk
text:
Source: FOX SPORTS WESTS Tigers woes continue with Luke Brooks sidelined with a hamstring injury. 
The halfback will miss Sunday’s clash with St George Illawarra which paved the way for Jack Littlejohn to claim the No.7 jersey. 
“Brooks is undergoing treatment on the hamstring and will be unavailable for selection for this week’s game against the St George Illawarra Dragons at ANZ Stadium,” a club statement said. 
Bulldogs half Moses Mbye has taken an early guilty plea for a shoulder charge which paves the way for another debutant to get his chance. 
Matt Frawley is favourite to get the nod but former Shark Josh Cleeland is also in the mix. 
Elliot Whitehead also entered an early guilty plea for tripping which opens the door for Dave Taylor in Canberra. 
But Gold Coast forward Ryan James will fight his shoulder charge. 
He faces a two-week ban if found guilty. 
Meanwhile, Penrith coach Anthony Griffin is hopeful Bryce Cartwright will be ready to return from injury against Melbourne on Saturday. Panthers thrash Knights 1:08 
The backrower picked up a bruised ankle in round two’s clash with the Tigers and will be monitored through the week before a decision is made on whether he’ll return. 
“He’s a week to week thing,” Griffin said. “We thought he might’ve been right (on Friday). He’s getting better every day. We’ll just wait and see for (Melbourne).” 
Meanwhile Kieran Foran is no certainty to return from a hamstring injury this week. 
A late scratching from Sunday’s loss to St George Illawarra, the Warriors half twinged his hamstring in the warm-up. 
Get all the latest team news ahead of Tuesday’s team announcements here. 
BULLDOGS V BRONCOS 
8.05pm AEDT Thursday, March 30 at ANZ Stadium 
Bulldogs mail: Moses Mbye is sidelined for a week after taking an early plea for a shoulder charge. The suspension opens the door for Matt Frawley or Josh Cleeland to make their NRL debut. 
Predicted Bulldogs team: Brad Abbey, Brett Morris, Josh Morris, Brenko Lee, Marcelo Montoya, Josh Reynolds, Matt Frawley, Aiden Tolman, Michael Lichaa, James Graham, Josh Jackson, Greg Eastwood, David Klemmer. Interchange: Sam Kasiano, Danny Fualalo, Adam Elliott, Raymond Faitala-Mariner. 18th and 19th man: Josh Cleeland and Reimis Smith Moses Mbye of the Bulldogs (R) walks from the field dejected. Source: Getty Images 
Broncos mail: No changes are expected. 
Predicted Broncos team: Darius Boyd, Corey Oates, James Roberts, Tautau Moga, Jordan Kahu, Anthony Milford, Ben Hunt, Korbin Sims, Andrew McCullough, Adam Blair, Sam Thaiday, Matt Gillett, Josh McGuire. Interchange: Alex Glenn, Tevita Pangai, Herman Ese’ese, Jai Arrow. 18th and 19th man: Benji Marshall, Joe Ofahengaue. 
ROOSTERS V SEA EAGLES 
6pm AEDT Friday, March 31 at Allianz Stadium 
Roosters mail: Blake Fergsuon (ribs) and Jake Friend (face) are likely to return. 
Predicted Roosters team: Michael Gordon, Daniel Tupou, Latrell Mitchell, Blake Ferguson, Shaun Kenny-Dowall, Luke Keary, Mitchell Pearce, Jared Waerea-Hargreaves, Jake Friend, Dylan Napa, Boyd Cordner, Mitchell Aubusson, Aidan Guerra. Interchange: Isaac Liu, Zane Tetevano, Ryan Matterson, Connor Watson, Paul Carter. 18th and 19th man: Chris Smith, Joseph Manu Manly devour Bulldogs 1:44 
Sea Eagles mail: Lloyd Perrett is ready to return from a fractured eye socket but unlikely to push his way into the 17. 
Predicted Sea Eagles team: Tom Trbojevic, Jorge Taufua, Dylan Walker, Brian Kelly, Akuila Uate, Blake Green, Daly Cherry-Evans, Brenton Lawrence, Api Koroisau, Martin Taupau, Frank Winterstein, Curtis Sironen, Jake Trbojevic. Interchange: Lewis Brown, Nate Myles, Jackson Hastings, Addin Fonua-Blake. 18th and 19th man: Jarrad Kennedy, Shaun Lane. 
Ben Ikin, Nathan Ryan and Ben Glover examine Jason Taylor’s sacking at the Wests Tigers and how it impacts the club and its roster going forward. 
You can also subscribe via iTunes or for Android users, listen on the iPP Podcast Player app. 
COWBOYS V RABBITOHS 
8.05pm AEDT Thursday, March 31 at 1300SMILES Stadium 
Cowboys mail: Jason Taumalolo returns from suspension. Lachlan Coote is also likely to return from a calf injury. 
Predicted Cowboys team: Lachlan Cooet, Kyle Feldt, Javid Bowen, Kane Linnett, Kalyn Ponga, Michael Morgan, Johnathan Thurston, Patrick Kaufusi, Jake Granvill, Scott Bolton, Gavin Cooper, Ethan Lowe, Jason Taumalolo. Interchange: Ben Hampton, Coen Hess, John Asiata, Shaun Fensom. 18th and 19th man: Gideon Gela-Mosby, Sam Hoare. Braidon Burns of the Rabbitohs runs in to score a try. Source: Getty Images 
Rabbitoh mail: Braidon Burns returns from suspension. 
Predicted Rabbitohs team: Alex Johnston, Braidon Burns, Siosifa Talakai, Robert Jennings, Bryson Goodwin, Cody Walker, Adam Reynolds, Thomas Burgess, Robbie Farah, Jason Clark, John Sutton, Kyle Turner, Sam Burgess. Interchange: Angus Crichton, Damien Cook, Robbie Rochow, Zane Musgrove. 18th and 19th man: Anthony Cherrington, Sitiveni Moceidreke 
SHARKS V KNIGHTS 
3pm AEDT Saturday, April 1 at Southern Cross Group Stadium 
Sharks mail: Wade Graham is expected to be right despite picking up a lower leg injury. James Segeyaro is likely to retain his place on the bench after playing the final 20 minutes last week. 
“He showed some energy Flanagan said of Segeyaro. “Was tidy out of dummy half and released some pressure off Jayden. As time goes on he’ll pull sides apart as they get tired.” Sharks make Eels pay 2:02 
Predicted Sharks team: Valentine Holmes, Sosaia Feki, Jack Bird, Gerard Beale, Ricky Leutele, James Maloney, Chad Townsend, Andrew Fifita, Jayden Brailey, Matt Prior, Luke Lewis, Wade Graham, Paul Gallen. Interchange: Jayson Bukuya, Chris Heighington, Jeremy Latimore, James Segeyaro. 18th and 19th man: Joseph Paulo, Kurt Capewell 
Knights mail: Brendan Elliot will return from concussion this week. Jaelen Feeney is on standby for Brock Lamb after he failed to train on Monday. 
Predicted Knights team: Brendan Elliot, Ken Sio, Dane Gagai, Peter Mata’utia, Nathan Ross, Brock Lamb, Trent Hodkinson, Daniel Saifiti, Danny Levi, Josh Starling, Sione Mata’utia, Jamie Buhrer, Mitch Barnett. Interchange: Luke Yates, Jack Stockwell, Sam Stone, Jacob Saifiti. 18th and 19th man: Anthony Tupou, Joe Wardle. 
RAIDERS V EELS 
5.30pm AEDT Saturday, April 1 at GIO Stadium 
Raider mail: Elliott Whitehead was charged by the NRL Match Review Committee for tripping and will miss a week after taking an early plea. The suspension opens the door for Dave Taylor to return. Dave Taylor at Raiders Headquarters in Canberra. Source: News Corp Australia 
Predicted Raiders team: Jack Wighton, Nick Cotric, Jarrod Croker, Joey Leilua, Jordan Rapana, Blake Austin, Aidan Sezer, Junior Paulo, Josh Hodgson, Shannon Boyd, Josh Papalii, Clay Priest, Luke Bateman. Interchange: Adam Clydsdale, Sia Soliola, Joseph Tapine, Dave Taylor. 18th and 19th man: Dunamis Lui, Scott Sorensen. 
Eels mail: Tepai Moeroa returns after a week on the sidelines through suspension. 
Predicted Eels team: Bevan French, Semi Radradra, Michael Jennings, Brad Takairangi, Josh Hoffman, Clint Gutherson, Corey Norman, Suaia Matagi, Kaysa Pritchard, Tim Mannah, Manu Ma’u, Tepai Moeroa, Beau Scott. Interchange: Nathan Brown, Daniel Alvaro, Frank Pritchard, David Gower. 18th and 19th man: Siosaia Vave, Rory O’Brien. 
STORM V PANTHERS 
7.30pm AEDT Saturday, April 1 at AAMI Park 
Storm mail: Christian Welch is expected to return from concussion and Jordan McLean from a calf issue. 
Predicted Storm team: Billy Slater, Young Tonumaipea, William Chambers, Cheyse Blair, Josh Addo-Carr, Ryley Jacks, Cooper Cronk, Jesse Bromwich, Cameron Smith, Jordan Mclean, Felise Kaufusi, Kenny Bromwich, Dale Finucane. Interchange: Christian Welch, Tim Glasby, Nelson Asofa Solomona, Vincent Leuluai. 18th and 19th man: Joe Stimson, Mark Nicholls. Bellamy snubs win applause 0:59 
Panthers mail: Bryce Cartwright is in line to return from a bruised foot. 
Predicted Panthers team: Matt Moylan, Dean Whare, Waqa Blake, Tyrone Peachey, Dallin Watene-Zelezniak, Te Maire Martin, Nathan Cleary, James Tamou, Peter Wallace, Reagan Campbell-Gillard, Bryce Cartwright, Isaah Yeo, Trent Merrin. Interchange: Peta Hiku, Leilani Latu, Viliame Kikau, Sitaleki Akauola. 18th and 19th man: Moses Leota, Corey Harawira-Naera. 
WARRIORS V TITANS 
2pm AEDT Sunday, April 2 at Mt Smart Stadium 
Warriors mail: Kieran Foran is likely to be named despite suffering a hamstring issue on Sunday. Fortunately for the five-eighth there was no tear. Manu Vatuvei (knee) and Ben Matulion (knee) are both scheduled to return from injury. 
Predicted Warriors team: Roger Tuivasa-Sheck, Ken Maumalo, David Fusitu’a, Solomone Kata, Manu Vatuvei, Kieran Foran, Shaun Johnson, Charlie Gubb, Issac Luke, Jacob Lillyman, Bodene Thompson, Ryan Hoffman, Simon Mannering. Interchange: Albert Vete, Sam Lisone, Bunty Afoa, Ben Matulino. 18th and 19th man: Tuimoala Lolohea, Ata Hingano. Titans skipper's high hit 0:36 
Titans mail: Ryan James will risk a two-game NRL ban by contesting a shoulder charge citing by the match review panel. 
Agnatius Paasi is in doubt with a shoulder injury which means the team could be forced to call on new recruit Chris Grevsmuhl earlier than expected. 
Predicted Titans team: Tyrone Roberts, Tyronne Roberts-Davis, Dale Copley, Konrad Hurrell, Daniel Vidot, Kane Elgey, Ash Taylor, Jarrod Wallace, Ryan Simpkins, Max King, Kevin Proctor, Chris McQueen, Agnatius Paasi. Interchange: Leivaha Pulu, Joe Greenwood, Karl Lawton, Morgan Boyle. 18th and 19th man: Pat Vaivai, Chris Grevsmuhl 
TIGERS V DRAGONS 
4pm AEDT Sunday, April 2 at ANZ Stadium 
Tigers mail: Luke Brooks is sidelined with a hamstring issue. Jack Littlejohn will replace him. 
Predicted Tigers team: James Tedesco, David Nofoaluma, Kevin Naiqama, Michael Chee Kam, Moses Suli, Mitchell Moses, Jack Littlejohn, Aaron Woods, Matt McIlwrick, Ava Seumanufagai, Sauaso Sue, Chris Lawrence, Elijah Taylor. Interchange: Josh Aloiai, Tim Grant, Joel Edwards, Jacob Liddle. 18th and 19th man: Kyle Lovett, Jamal Idris. 
Dragons mail: No changes expected. 
Predicted Dragons team: Josh Dugan, Nene Macdonald, Euan Aitken, Tim Lafai, Jason Nightingale, Gareth Widdop, Josh McCrone, Russell Packer, Cameron McInnes, Paul Vaughan, Tyson Frizell, Joel Thompson, Jack de Belin. Interchange: Tariq Sims, Leeson Ah Mau, Jacob Host, Kurt Mann. 18th and 19th man: Taane Milne, Hame Sele
